before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2lm64","text":"Equipment set up and reagent preparation is performed prior to receiving tissue into the laboratory. \n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8mhsr","text":"Microindentation of fresh biological tissues is necessary for the creation of 3D biomimetic models that accurately represent the native extracellular matrix microenvironment. However, tissue must first be precisely sectioned into slices. Challenges exist in the preparation of fresh tissue slices, as they can tear easily and must be processed rapidly in order to mitigate tissue degradation. In this study, we propose an optimised mounting condition for microindentation and demonstrate that embedding tissue in a mixture of 2.5% agarose and 1.5% gelatin is the most favourable method of tissue slice mounting for microindentation. This protocol allows for rapid processing of fresh biological tissue and is applicable to a variety of tissue types.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u913","text":"\n\n","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Irish Research Council Enterprise Partnership Scheme with Becton Dickinson

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0hho","text":"Process the tissue immediately on arrival to the laboratory.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2cua","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sij2","text":"Maintain tissue hydration in 1X PBS throughout the experiment.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nbvg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bke99","text":"Prepare 1X PBS for use as a solvent for the embedding solution and as a buffer during tissue sectioning.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"980m1","text":"Place the chilling block (Figure 1a) into the   freezer for approximately   prior to use.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"24g1m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"du5d8","text":"Prepare embedding solution in  of 1X PBS and heat in a microwave to dissolve. When the agarose and gelatin have dissolved, place in the preheated water bath between   to cool the solution down before embedding.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":165,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"et42i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"34-37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rme5","text":"Cut the tissue into 10 mm2 sections using the scalpel and place onto a petri dish. Cover the tissue in 1X PBS and place it   for approximately   (Figure 3c). Once the tissue is ready to be embedded, gently dab the tissue with blotting paper to remove excess moisture (6). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":25,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":123,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":143,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dp9tu","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ah7u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mei2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":237},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":632}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":406,"style":"sup"},{"length":1,"offset":468,"style":"sup"}],"key":"5cdaj","text":"Agarose and gelatin gel blocks may be required for soft mucosal tissue e.g. porcine colon, to help stabilise it as otherwise the tissue will collapse against the side of the specimen tube, making embedding difficult. In these cases, add   of the liquid agarose and gelatin embedding solution to a petri dish and place it on ice to cool (approximately 3 mm in thickness). Once cooled, cut the gel into 10 mm2 sections (7). Apply a small amount of superglue to the 10 mm2 gel block and carefully stick the outer layer of the tissue sections to this block i.e. area of interest should be facing upwards. Leave to dry for approximately  .","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"B71BAFC8680E11EE836F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"2","duration":60,"error":false,"guid":"B71BB05A680E11EE836F0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"duration"}}}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6u5vl","text":"Apply a small amount of superglue to create a thin layer on the surface of the white plunger of the specimen tube (Figure 1c) and carefully adhere one side of the tissue to the base of the white plunger using a tweezers, Figure 3d. Take care to orientate the tissue so that the area of interest is sectioned appropriately. This secures the tissue in place before the embedding solution is added to the tissue. Allow to dry for approximately  .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":441,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3008f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"alie9","text":"Once dry, slide the metal tube of the specimen tube (Figure 1d) over the white plunger so that it is level with the height of the tissue, Figure 3d. The tissue is now ready for embedding with the embedding solution.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2a3cs","text":"Hold the combined specimen tube containing the tissue sample at a 45o angle and slowly pipette in the agarose and gelatin embedding solution until the specimen tube is full. Ensure that no air bubbles are in the solution, Figure 3e.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"70u97","text":"Remove the chilling block from the   freezer and slide over the specimen tube for approximately   until a hard gel is formed, Figure 3f.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":96,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7tiqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"407cb","text":"Place the specimen into the holder on the buffer tray and secure in place using the thumbscrew. Add the chilled 1X PBS to the buffer tray, Figure 3g.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5002n","text":"Attach the blade holder to the vibrating head unit by sliding it onto the axial bar and secure in place with an Allen wrench.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"djr3t","text":"As per the manual guidelines of the Compresstome‱, begin with bigger cutting thicknesses e.g. 1 mm and work in reducing increments to the required thickness in approximately three cuts.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1122C3CB681411EE836F0A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40t1b","text":"To mount the tissue for microindentation, gently remove sections from the buffer tray with a paintbrush and place on a drop of liquid agarose and gelatin in a petri dish. The tissue is kept hydrated in 1X PBS at approximately   before indentation to mitigate tissue degradation, Figure 3h,i. The fresh tissue sections should undergo microindentation within 2 hours of receiving the tissue into the laboratory. Disassemble as per the manual and clean glue off the embedding block and blade mount with acetone.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":226,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpd6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fgv5b","text":"Phosphate Buffered Saline (PBS) is used as a buffer for tissue sectioning and as a solvent for the agarose and gelatin embedding solution. Prepare   of a 10X concentration of PBS stock solution by dissolving   NaCl,   KCl,   Na2HPO4 and  KH2PO4 into   of deionised water. The pH of the PBS is set at 7.4 with a pH meter by adding 5M NaOH to the solution. For the experiment, prepare   of 1X PBS by adding   of deionised water to   10X PBS. The solution is kept at on melting ice. 1X PBS is also used as a solvent for the embedding solution.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":227,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":231,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":240,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":243,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":208,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":216,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":223,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":237,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":250,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":383,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":405,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":429,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":463,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50l6i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"80","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"17.8","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.7","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"8":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientifi steps.section: Preparation of 2.5% (wt/vol) agarose and 1.5% (wt/vol) gelatin for tissue embedding
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ipeh","text":"Weigh   agarose and   gelatin in a   glass bottle and add   of 1X PBS to make a 2.5% concentration of agarose and 1.5% gelatin solution. According to the Compresstome‱ VF-210-0Z (Precisionary Instruments, Massachusetts USA)manual 2.5% agarose is the optimum concentration for cutting soft biological tissues such as cardiac, kidney and intestinal tissue. Heat the bottle in the microwave until the agarose and gelatin have dissolved, stopping the microwave\nevery 10-15 seconds to mix the solution with a spatula spoon to ensure the agarose and gelatin are fully dissolved. Once ready, place the bottle in a water bath between   until required for embedding. Do not leave the embedding solution for longer than  , as the embedding solution will solidify after this time point. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":166,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":626,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":710,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbc4r","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhpd7","text":" steps.section: Equipment Setup: Vibratome
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"q980","text":"The Compresstome‱ VF-210-0Z (Precisionary Instruments, Massachusetts USA) is set up according to the manufacturing guidelines and is shown in Figure 2a. Briefly, this vibratome uses controllable oscillations and speed to slice through tissue without the use of freezing or fixation of the fresh biological tissue. The oscillation frequency and speed settings are 14 Hz and 14 mm/s respectively. The razor blade is prepared with scissors as per the user manual and attached to the blade holder using superglue (Figure 1g). The chilled 1X PBS is added to the buffer tray just before sectioning commences (Figure 1b). steps.section: Preparation of fresh human tissue for sectioning with vibratome
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jkj9","text":"Human vascular tissue is sourced from the Department of Surgery, University Hospital Limerick, Limerick, Ireland. The study is approved by the institutional review board and conducted in accordance with ethical guidelines (Research Ethics Committee #118/18 and 100/15 (vascular tissue) and #031/2021 (colorectal tissue). Patient recruitment is carried out with informed consent. Segments of tissue specimens for testing are selected by the operating surgeon and placed into   1X PBS immediately post-surgical excision from the patient as this mitigates tissue degradation (4, 5). The tissue specimens are transferred into 1X PBS and transported to the University of Limerick in an insulated cooler box, to maintain a temperature of approximately  The tissue is cut with the scalpel into 10 mm2 sections and placed onto a petri dish. The tissue sections are submerged in 1X PBS and placed on melting ice between  to cool for approximately  , Figure 3a-c. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":792,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":474,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":745,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":911,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":938,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ahp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39q8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Preparation of porcine human tissue for sectioning with vibratome
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8dpqe","text":"Porcine tissue is sourced from a local abattoir (Ballylanders, Co. Limerick, Ireland), which allows for testing within 2-3 hours of sacrifice (animals are already sacrificed for consumption and not for the purpose of this experiment). It is then placed into   1X PBS immediately post harvest, as this promotes tissue viability (4,5). From the tissue samples, using the scalpel, an approximately 40 mm length of tissue is cut and excess fat is removed from this section. Next, the section is cut longitudinally and washed multiple times in 1X PBS to remove mucous, bile and excrement etc. The tissue is cut into 10 mm2 sections and placed onto a petri dish. The tissue sections are submerged in 1X PBS and placed on melting ice between   to cool for approximately  .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":616,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":258,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":735,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":763,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"biv46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b210i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"0-4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ea2fj","text":"Turn on the water bath and ensure that the temperature is between  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0jjg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"34-37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Procedure for the fresh biological tissue sectioning with the Compresstome® VF-210-0Z
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"qnaab","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"iqin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpj99","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"82hq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r62b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":422,"id":448875,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"22jft\",\"text\":\"Figure 3 Example of tissue preparation, embedding and sectioning for microindentation using human vascular tissue. (a) Human tissue is obtained on the day of surgery. (b) A region of tissue is isolated and cut to approximately 10 mm2 for microindentation. (c) Samples are hydrated in 1X PBS and placed on ice for approximately 10 minutes prior to embedding. (d) The tissue segment is glued to the white specimen tube and allowed to dry for 1 minute. The metal specimen tube is placed onto the white specimen tube once the glue is dry. (e) The agarose and gelatin embedding solution is added to the specimen tube. (f) The filled specimen tube is rapidly cooled with a chilling block or on ice for approximately 1 minute. (g) The cooled specimen tube is mounted into the vibratome. (h) The tissue is sectioned to the desired thickness. (i) The tissue section is mounted onto the liquid agarose and gelatin embedding solution. The tissue is hydrated in 1X PBS before microindentation Parts of the figure were reprinted from Servier Medical Art under CC BY icence (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/deed.en) with permission from Servier, original copyright 2023.\",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":9},{\"style\":\"sup\",\"offset\":232,\"length\":1}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Process Flow.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pympb9jip.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pymmb9jip.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pymnb9jip.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pymkb9jip.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Microindentation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"77sef","text":"Microindentation is performed using the Chiaro Nanoindenter (Optics 11, the Netherlands), Figure 2b. Before each experiment, the probe is calibrated by submerging the cantilever in 1X PBS and using a glass calibration dish. The study is performed at room temperature to prevent measurement error due to temperature drift. The Petri dishes containing the tissue sample are mounted onto an Olympus IX73 microscope, thus allowing visualisation of the tissue during the experiment under the 10X brightfield setting. 1X PBS is added, via pipetting, to keep the tissue samples hydrated during the indenting process. Areas of damaged or torn tissue are avoided and indenting is performed away from the edge of the tissue. The probes used to perform this microindentation are within the 0.25 N/m cantilever stiffness and 50 µm radius spherical tip range of probes. An automated 3x3 matrix scan, spaced in 100 μm increments to avoid overlapping, is performed (3). Ultimately, this process allows for the suitable microindentation of fresh soft biological tissue. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":529,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":953,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
